results.title: For all the world's children
results.creator_credit: William K McClure, Alfred Butterfield, UNICEF and Warner-Pathe News
results.brief_description: Portrays the world-wide activities of the United Naitons International Children’s Emergency Fund (UNICEF). Shows all phases of UNICEF’s operations, from the shipment of supplies to child feeding in Europe and the Middle East. Includes sequences on malaria control and anti-tuberculosis vaccination in India. Narrated by Dwight Weist.

results.title: For all practical purposes. Computer science. 5
results.creator_credit: Joseph Blatt, Chedd-Angier Productions and COMAP
results.brief_description: Moving picture show Computers can be used to produce a remarkable range of graphics and this program looks at how these graphics are produced. Pixels are the fundamental unit of computer images, and nothing can be drawn smaller than a pixel, which means that lines can be jagged rather than smooth. We look at anti-aliasing techniques which solve this and algorithms which solve the problems of limited time and memory. We then look at three programs from Symbolics Inc. - “Geometry” which creates 3D objects, “Dynamics” which moves them and “Render” which makes them realistic. Demonstrated techniques include splining, translation, scaling, rotation, texture mapping and opacity.

results.title: Food: the story of a peanut butter sandwich
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, International Cinemedia Center and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: At a children’s party a contest is held to see who can make the most interesting sandwich. The popularity of peanut butter leads to an inquiry into food processing, its mechanics and economics. The filmmaker poses questions to the children about the origin of food, especially peanut butter, filling in the historical, geographic, cultural and other factors.

results.title: Food that builds good health
results.brief_description: A young boy called Art is not eating a balanced diet, so is weak and lethargic. A school demonstration with two guinea pigs on different diets convinces Art that he should change his eating habits.

results.title: Food safety guidelines for community food events
results.brief_description: This video is designed to instruct people involved in producing food for community events such as fetes, festivals and food fairs, in its safe preparation, storage and cooking. It provides advice on ways to prevent contamination of food and is accompanied by pads of mini-posters (for distribution), reminding people of the basics of food safety. Kit contains a video cassette and two booklets.
